com.spazedog.lib.rootfw4

Class Shell

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spazedog.lib.rootfw4.Shell

  • public class Shell
extends Object
    This class is a front-end to ShellStream which makes it easier to work with normal shell executions. If you need to execute a consistent command (one that never ends), you should work with ShellStream directly.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Shell.Attempts
      A class containing automatically created shell attempts and links to both Shell#executeAsync(String[], Integer[], OnShellResultListener) and Shell#execute(String[], Integer[])

      All attempts are created based on Common.BINARIES.
      static interface  Shell.OnShellBroadcastListener
      This interface is used internally across utility classes.
      static interface  Shell.OnShellConnectionListener
      This interface is used to get information about connection changes.
      static interface  Shell.OnShellResultListener
      This interface is for use with executeAsync(String[], OnShellResultListener).
      static interface  Shell.OnShellValidateListener
      This interface is for use with the execute methods.
      static class  Shell.Result
      This class is used to store the result from shell executions.

      • execute

        public Shell.Result execute(String[] commands,
                            Integer[] resultCodes,
                            Shell.OnShellValidateListener validater)
        Execute a range of commands until one is successful.

        Android shells differs a lot from one another, which makes it difficult to program shell scripts for. This method can help with that by trying different commands until one works.

        Shell.execute( new String(){"cat file", "toolbox cat file", "busybox cat file"} );

        Whether or not a command was successful, depends on addResultCode(Integer) which by default only contains '0'. The command number that was successful can be checked using Shell.Result.getCommandNumber().
        Parameters:
        commands - The commands to try
        resultCodes - Result Codes representing successful execution. These will be temp. merged with addResultCode(Integer).
        validater - A Shell.OnShellValidateListener instance or NULL

      • executeAsync

        public void executeAsync(String command,
                         Shell.OnShellResultListener listener)
        Execute a shell command asynchronous.
        Parameters:

        listener - A Shell.OnShellResultListener callback instance
        See Also:

        validater - A Shell.OnShellValidateListener instance or NULL
        listener - A Shell.OnShellResultListener callback instance

        public void addShellConnectionListener(Shell.OnShellConnectionListener listener)
        Add a shell connection listener. This callback will be invoked whenever the connection to the shell changes.
        Parameters:

      • isRoot

        public Boolean isRoot()
        Check whether or not root was requested for this shell.

      • isConnected

        public Boolean isConnected()
        Check whether or not a shell connection was established.

      • getTimeout

        public Integer getTimeout()
        Get the current shell execution timeout. This is the time in milliseconds from which an execution is killed in case it has stalled.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(Integer timeout)
        Change the shell execution timeout. This should be in milliseconds. If this is set to '0', there will be no timeout.

      • addResultCode

        public void addResultCode(Integer resultCode)
        Add another result code that represent a successful execution. By default only '0' is used, since most shell commands uses '0' for success and '1' for error. But some commands uses different values, like 'cat' that uses '130' as success when piping content.
        Parameters:
        resultCode - The result code to add to the stack

      • removeResultCode

        public void removeResultCode(Integer resultCode)
        Remove a result code from the stack.
        Parameters:
        resultCode - The result code to remove from the stack
        See Also:
        addResultCode(Integer)

      • resetResultCodes

        public void resetResultCodes()
        Reset the stack containing result codes and set it back to default only containing '0'.
        See Also:
        addResultCode(Integer)

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Close the shell connection using 'exit 0' if possible, or by force and release all data stored in this instance.
